head.title: ALANTRO COMMUNICATIONS AGREES TO A $300 MILLION DEAL

hedline.hl1: ALANTRO COMMUNICATIONS AGREES TO A $300 MILLION DEAL

abstract.p: Texas Instruments agrees to acquire chip-manufacturer Alantro Communications for $300 million (S)

block.p: Texas Instruments Inc. said yesterday that it had agreed to acquire the closely held chip maker Alantro Communications for $300 million in stock. Alantro, based in Santa Rosa, Calif., makes semiconductors for wireless networks that let multiple computers or other devices link to the Internet through one high-speed connection. The products work in tandem with Texas Instruments' digital-signal processors, the crucial chips in fast Internet connections like cable modems and digital subscriber lines. The acquisition builds on Texas Instruments' purchase of Butterfly VLSI Ltd. of Israel in January 1999. Butterfly makes chips that let cell phones, computers and digital cameras interact with one another.
